content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or preferences. However, I can tell you that there are many album artworks that are considered iconic, visually striking or memorable, and have become well-known in popular culture. 

For example, Pink Floyd's "Dark Side of the Moon" album artwork, a simple prism design on a black background, is instantly recognizable and has become a cultural icon. The cover of The Beatles' "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band", featuring a collage of famous figures, is also a classic and memorable design. 

In recent years, many artists have used surreal or abstract designs for their album artwork, such as Tame Impala's "Currents" or Arcade Fire's "Reflektor".  Other notable examples include Nirvana's "Nevermind," Pink Floyd's "The Wall," and Kendrick Lamar's "To Pimp a Butterfly."
